Date an International Patent Classification (IPC) is issued for the patent
Second hierarchical level of the IPC system, sections are subdivided into classes
H defining Human - Generated, M defining Machine - Generated and G defining Generated via Software
I  defining invention information or N defining non - invention information

Subdivisions of the IPC subclass

Highest hierarchical levels of the IPC corresponding to broad technical fields ( A = Human Necessitates, B = Performing Operations; Transporint, C = Chemistry; Metallurgy, D = Textiles; paper, E = Fixed Constructing, F = Mechanical Engineering; Lighting; Heating; Weapons; Blasting Engines; Pumps, G = Physics, H = Electricity)
Order of the IPC classification in the list of classifications for the selected patent

Subdivisions of IPC main group

First or later position of symbols. The position of the first invention information classification can be recognized by this field. The letters "F" and "L" are used for the first and later position, respectively.
